page.title: 06MIDDLETON RAILWAY,S.LEEDS
page.content: The Middleton Railway(O.S. sheet104 307294-304304), is the oldest railway in the world, and was authorised by an Act of Parliament in 1758.It was a colliery railway built to supply the town and neighbourhood of Leeds with coal. The first mention of coal was in 1202,when William Grammary was Lord of Middleton.When Charles Brandling inherited the Middleton Estates in 1749,he built a wagon way with flanged rails. In 1808 John Blenkinsop,the manager, appointed Matthew Murray as engineer They designed a steam locomotive which ran on a rack rail. The Middleton Colliery was working until 1968,and used 20 different locomotives,built by local firms such as the Hunslet Engine Company and Hudswell Clarke from 1812 to 1954.
